posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
In the level 40 "Green Knight of Ehlonna" thread Regsa brougth up the possibility to build a Druid/ Bard/ AA archer. I started to look into it.
I have chosen to focus on the Druid levels, but still make it an archer with just enough AA levels to pierce Stoneskins/Premonition and give it a good warrior AB. Choosing to focus on wisdom and Zen archery also gives a fair spell DC. Bard is there as the glue that makes the pieces stick together, but also offers some class skills. The thing is feat starved, and more so when I choose Half elf rather than elf to avoid an xp penalty. Blind Fight and Rapid shot are on the whish list and compete with Called shot and Improved critical. The high wisdom let me pick Dragon shape on an odd feat slot  at level 39.
I want to ask you experienced Druid players if this build makes sense at all.  And if it does, if there are ways to improve it and tailor it better to how the Druid class works.
SpoilerDruid(28), Bard(3), Arcane Archer(9), Half-Elf DEX: 14 WIS: 16 (32) CHA: 8 01: Druid(1): Point Blank Shot 03: Bard(1): Weapon Proficiency Martial 05: Druid(4) 07: Druid(6) 09: Druid(8): Weapon Focus: Longbow 11: Arcane Archer(1) 13: Arcane Archer(2) 15: Arcane Archer(4): Called Shot 17: Arcane Archer(6) 19: Arcane Archer(8) 21: Druid(11): Epic Weapon Focus: Longbow 23: Druid(12) 25: Druid(14) 27: Druid(16): Great Wisdom I, (WIS=23) 29: Druid(18) 31: Druid(20) 33: Druid(22): Great Wisdom III, (WIS=27) 35: Druid(24): Great Wisdom IV, (WIS=28) 37: Bard(3) 39: Druid(27): Dragon Shape Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 23/33/23 BAB: 26 AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 20/28 Alignment Changes: 0 Skillpoints: 258

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This looks nice Mick

I would probably put the Epic Weapon Focus and Epic Prowess later in the build and put some great wisdoms earlier to see if you can get Dragon Shape earlier, getting dragon shape is a huge powerspike in the build, and I think you will have enough AB

I'd swap empower spell for Rapid Shot 

I'd consider pumping discipline if possible in any druid build if you have access to it as a class skill. Knockdown immunity tends to come from helmets (ie Thieves Hood) and having high discipline means you can safely forget about it in dragon form (heh yes I did get knocked down in dragon form when I didn't have KI or discipline!). Most knockdown immunity items are from boots, which don't transfer in most modules when one polymorphs.

Hope that helps Mick!
